overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students explore a situation modeled with a system of linear equations in standard form. They determine the intersection of the lines graphically and algebraically using substitution. Students write a system of equations for given situations. They solve each system graphically and algebraically, concluding that for any system, there is no solution, one solution, or infinitely many solutions.

overview_item_data_items: I can write equations in standard form.
I can write and interpret the solution to a system of equations in terms of a problem situation.
I can solve for and use the intersection of two lines in standard form.
I can solve systems of linear equations exactly and approximately.
I can determine whether the system of two linear equations has one solution, no solution, or infinitely many solutions.
You can solve the <math><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math><mi>y</mi></math>-intercepts to graph linear functions written in standard form.
The graph of an equation in two variables is the set of all its solutions plotted on the coordinate plane.
A linear system of equations is two or more linear equations that define a relationship between quantities.
The solution of a linear system is an ordered pair that makes both equations in the system true.
Consistent systems of equations have one or many solutions.
Inconsistent systems of equations have no solutions.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students analyze two linear graphs from a given situation.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Determining the Solution to a System of Linear Equations
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students approximate the solution to a system of equations using a graph and the Desmos tool.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Systems with No Solution, One Solution, or Infinitely Many Solutions
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students write and solve systems of equations graphically and algebraically using the substitution method.
Students contrast consistent and inconsistent systems of linear equations.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
